title: Senior .Net Utvecklare
description:
Är du passionerad kring att bygga skalbara, säkra och robusta backend-lösningar – och vill arbeta med teknik som gör verklig skillnad inom välfärd och trygghet? ASSA ABLOY söker nu en erfaren Senior .NET Utvecklare till vårt utvecklingsteam i Norrköping. Här får du utveckla produkter inom digital nyckelhantering, larm och trygghetssystem som används dagligen av kommuner, vårdpersonal och användare över hela landet. Du blir en del av en modern R&D-organisation som arbetar tätt tillsammans i tvärfunktionella team med mekanik, elektronik, embedded, QA, apputveckling och backend.



Bli en del av vårt team och upplev en samarbetskultur som ger dig möjlighet att bygga en karriär som du kan vara stolt över.

  


**Vad du kommer att göra som vår Senior .NET Utvecklare**



Som senior utvecklare kommer du huvudsakligen arbeta hands-on med backendutveckling i .NET, där du driver utvecklingen av våra backendplattformar och molntjänster. Du utvecklar nya lösningar, moderniserar befintliga system och säkerställer att de är skalbara, prestandastarka och fungerar för stora datamängder och många användare. I ditt arbete ingår även säker utveckling, inklusive säker kodning, sårbarhetshantering, secure code reviews och best practices för applikationssäkerhet, samt att skriva högkvalitativ, ren och testbar kod enligt moderna utvecklingsmönster.


Du kommer också att:


* Delta i och leda tekniska diskussioner, bidra med lösningsförslag och påverka tekniska val.
* Arbeta nära produktägare, test, UX och embedded-team för att skapa helhetslösningar.
* Stötta och vägleda mindre erfarna utvecklare och delta i förbättringar av CI/CD, deployment och pipelines.
* Vara delaktig i arbetet med att bygga nästa generations plattform.

  


**De färdigheter och erfarenheter du behöver**



Vi söker någon som har:


* Minst 5+ års erfarenhet av systemutveckling i C# och .NET.
* Gedigen erfarenhet av molnlösningar, gärna Azure, samt CI/CD och automatiserade pipelines.
* God förståelse för databaser, både SQL och NoSQL, samt datamodellering, optimering och systemintegration.
* Erfarenhet av API:er, integrationer och microservice-orienterade arkitekturer.
* Flytande svenska och engelska, samt trygghet i att leda tekniska delar av projekt och team, inklusive att påverka lösningar, driva tekniska diskussioner och säkerställa hög prestanda, tillgänglighet och säkerhet.

Som senior utvecklare är du analytisk, strukturerad och prestigelös. Du trivs i samarbeten, är nyfiken och delar gärna med dig av din kunskap. Meriterande är erfarenhet av säkerhetsarbete inom utveckling (OWASP, threat modelling, hardening), system som interagerar med hårdvara, IoT eller larmplattformar, samt arbete i agila tvärfunktionella team. Du har lätt att se helheter och vågar utmana när det behövs – alltid med målet att bygga hållbara, skalbara och trygga lösningar.

  


**Vi erbjuder:**



Vi erbjuder fantastiska möjligheter och fördelar, så att du kan fortsätta och utveckla en livslång karriär hos oss – här är vad vi har att erbjuda:


* Utbildningsmöjligheter och karriärutveckling, oavsett om det handlar om online-utbildning, ledarträning eller att förbättra dina färdigheter inom en trevlig arbetsmiljö
* En konkurrenskraftig lön, förmåner som till exempel friskvårdsbidrag.
* Flexibla arbetstider och hybridmodell

  


**Vi granskar ansökningar regelbundet, så vänta inte!**



Vi bygger mångsidiga och inkluderande team och uppmanar ansökningar från alla som kan se sig själva arbeta med oss.



För att säkerställa att din personliga information är säker, behandlar vi inte några ansökningar som skickas via e-post eller post. Om du har några frågor om rollen eller processen, skicka ett e-postmeddelande till Khalil Kabakibi, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, på Khalil.kabakibi@assaabloy.com.



Låt oss tillsammans skapa en tryggare och mer öppen värld!



För att få reda på mer om oss, besök www.assaabloy.com.

  


**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**  

Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 63,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.
company_description: Let’s create a safer and more open world – together!

title: TEAM LEAD & BACKEND SOFTWARE DEVELOPER
description:
THE WOW
   


 As a Team Lead at Betsson Group, you will lead a team of talented people and take overall responsibility for team performance. As the Team Lead, you will take an active role in driving the delivery of your team and promoting a healthy team spirit and culture. You will also participate as a developer in designing and developing next generation Engagement products for the iGaming industry.  
 


  

 ABOUT THE JOB
   



 As part of this team, you will use cutting edge technology to develop highly scalable and resilient application. As a team lead you will also enable us to get these applications into the hands of our users safely, quickly, and sustainably. In Engagement Area, We develop products to boost customer engagement. Our goal is to provide the best customer experience on the market, and we do that through personalized communication, interesting and fun promotions, and gamification. We work closely with our commercial users to ensure we deliver the best CRM tools and products. All designed and developed by us and delivered safely, quickly and sustainably using best-if-bread technologies and processes. 
 



  

 As a Team Lead and Backend Developer, your day to day will look like
   

  
* People management, mentoring and coaching developers, taking part in recruiting and onboarding, performance reviews, personal development planning and 1-to-1’s.
  
* Close collaboration with Product Managers, Architects, and Stakeholders to understand and implement business requirements.
  
* Software development according to modern best practices and principles.
  
* Taking part in the decision-making process for design or improvement of application architecture, solution development, architecture, and code review
  


  

 WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
   

  
* Experience in software development for more than 5 years
  
* Experience of managing teams of software engineers
  
* Strong leadership and communication skills
  
* Agile mindset, business goals orientation
  
* Excellent knowledge and experience in C#, .NET Framework, and .NET Core
  


  

 WHAT DOES OUR TECH STACK LOOK LIKE?
   


 At Betsson, we pride ourselves on adaptability and keeping up with the latest technologies. Our current tech stack looks like this
 


  

  
* C#, .NET Framework, .NET Core,
  
* AWS, Kubernetes, Docker
  
* PostgreSQL, MSSQL, Redis, Couchbase
  
* Apache Kafka, RabbitMQ
  
* Prometheus, Loki, Grafana
  
* GitHub
  


  

 WHAT WE OFFER
   


 Life at Betsson can be lightning fast with twists and turns but always FUN! Then again, what else would you expect from a business 75% millennial and 1700 strong, spread across 7 offices with 900 based out of our Malta HQ alone! We recognize it may not be for the faint-hearted, but if you’re a go-getter, initiator and adrenaline junkie, always striving to push the boundaries and challenge yourself, then you’ll fit right in.
 


  


 We offer numerous challenges where your skills will be put to good use! We encourage innovation, independence and celebrate success where you will be part of multi-cultural and diverse company, with people from all over the world.
 


  

 CHALLENGE ACCEPTED?
   


 If you are interested to learn more, please apply with your CV.
 


  


 Check out the Betsson Group Blog to find out what our employees are talking about
 


  


 By submitting your application, you understand that your personal data will be processed as set out in our Privacy Policy

title: Unity Developer Intern [Remote]
description:
**About XR Solutions** 




 XR Solutions is a technology-driven company pioneering
 **machine learning-powered augmented reality solutions** 
 for industrial clients.
 



 Our mission is to revolutionize how machines are operated, maintained, and optimized — enabling workflows and innovations that were once impossible. We combine research-based optimizations with cutting-edge AR technology to create
 **practical, reliable, and high-performance solutions** 
 that reshape industries.
 



 This internship offers a rare opportunity to
 **build backend systems that directly power advanced AR applications** 
 used in real-world industrial environments.
 



  





**Role Overview** 




 We’re looking for a
 **passionate, detail-oriented Unity Developer Intern** 
 with a strong interest in XR interaction and immersive technologies.
 



 While the internship is
 **initially unpaid** 
 , outstanding performance could lead to a
 **future paid opportunity** 
 .
 



  





**What You’ll Do** 



* Collaborate with developers on
 **XR features** 
 and infrastructure
* Design, develop, and test interactive UI/UX for AR applications
* Integrate and support backend systems and services
* Conduct research into AR technologies, including hardware like
 **HMDs**
* Contribute to product design and optimization ahead of our first pilot launch
* Help solve complex, real-world challenges using cutting-edge tools



  





**What You’ll Gain** 



* Hands-on experience building XR applications used in industry
* Deep exposure to
 **Unity** 
 ,
 **ARKit** 
 , and backend systems integration
* Real-world application of UI/UX principles in immersive environments
* Insight into the full development lifecycle of AR products
* A chance to work on a product preparing for its first commercial deployment
* Experience in a collaborative, startup-style tech environment



  





**What We’re Looking For** 



* Proficiency in
 **Unity** 
 and
 **ARKit**
* Proficiency in
 **C#**
* Experience with
 **3D modeling** 
 tools (e.g., Blender, Maya)
* Knowledge of
 **Figma** 
 for UI/UX design
* Passion for XR, AR, and immersive technologies
* Familiarity with
 **Xcode** 
 and
 **HMDs** 
 (head-mounted displays) is a plus



  





  





 If you’re excited about this opportunity and eager to learn, please send your resume outlining your interest in the position. We look forward to helping you grow your skills and advance your career in backend development.

title: .Net Developer
description:
**Expleo** 
 is seeking a highly skilled and experienced
 **.Net Developer** 
 to join our team in
 **Stockholm, Sweden.**
 Our
 **ideal** 
 candidate possess the ability to write functional code and have a keen eye for identifying and resolving defects. Your primary objective will be to collaborate with our internal teams to design, develop, and maintain high-quality software solutions.
   

  

 If you have a genuine passion for the .NET framework and possess a strong understanding of software design and architecture , and you are excited about shaping the future of technology, we encourage you to apply and be part of the Expleo team in Sweden.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Participate in requirements analysis
* Collaborate with internal teams to produce software design and architecture
* Write clean, scalable code using .NET programming languages
* Test and deploy applications and systems
* Revise, update, refactor and debug code
* Improve existing software
* Develop documentation throughout the software development life cycle (SDLC)
* Serve as an expert on applications and provide technical support


**Qualifications**
* Proven experience as a .NET Developer
* Familiarity with the ASP.NET framework, SQL Server and design/architectural patterns (e.g. Model-View-Controller (MVC))
* Knowledge of at least one of the .NET languages (e.g. C#, Visual Basic .NET) and HTML5/CSS3
* Familiarity with architecture styles/APIs (REST, RPC)
* Understanding of Agile methodologies
* Excellent troubleshooting and communication skills
* Attention to detail
* BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering or a related field
* Experience with salesforce application will be beneficial


**Benefits**
**Who are we?**
 Expleo is a rapidly growing consulting company dedicated to delivering innovative solutions in the fields of AI engineering, digitalization, hyper-automation, cybersecurity, and data science. With a strong commitment to integrity, diversity, sustainability, and societal security, Expleo is at the forefront of creating a better future. Join our dynamic team and be part of our journey to shape the future of technology and business.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
* Join a rapidly growing consulting company at the forefront of technological innovation.
* Work in a dynamic and diverse environment that values integrity and sustainability.
* Collaborate with experts in AI engineering, digitalization, hyper-automation, cybersecurity, and data science.
* Opportunities for career growth and development.
* Be part of a team dedicated to creating a more secure and sustainable society.


 "We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age ”.

title: Senior Fullstack Developer – Build the Future of Mobility with Aimo IT
description:
*By continuing to think innovatively and always putting people’s needs first, we believe we can make a real difference. As the leading mobility partner in the Nordic region, we are constantly developing new solutions that make everyday life simpler and more sustainable. We are Aimo.*
**About The Job**
 We’re looking for an experienced
 **Fullstack Developer** 
 who wants real ownership, real influence, and real engineering challenges.
   

  

 In this role, you will work across the entire stack — designing, building, and improving the systems that power Aimo’s core business operations. This includes both customer-facing products and the internal workflows that keep daily operations running smoothly.
   

  

 You’re joining at a pivotal moment: Aimo is transitioning from a complex, tightly coupled environment to a
 **modular, scalable, and sustainable architecture** 
 . The decisions you make will directly shape how we build software for years to come.
   

  

 This role is grounded in
 **self-leadership** 
 . We believe senior engineers should have the space to think, decide, build, and take full end-to-end responsibility — and at Aimo, you truly have that space.
   

  

**About You**
 You’re a senior Fullstack Developer who brings depth, ownership, and engineering maturity to your work. You thrive in environments where autonomy is expected and supported, and where collaboration with engineers, designers, and product owners is natural.
   

  

 You like solving complex technical problems, designing clean systems, and improving long-term architecture. You care deeply about maintainable, high-quality code — and you enjoy seeing the real impact your work has on users and business outcomes.
   

  

 You’ll succeed here if you:
   

  

 Must haves:
   

  

* Have strong fullstack experience (Java, React, React Native, GraphQL, TypeScript/JavaScript, REST APIs, NoSQL databases.
* Enjoy working in complex systems and making them simpler
* Think in terms of architecture, not just features
* Communicate clearly and collaborate naturally
* Care about code quality, performance, and maintainability
* Want autonomy — and take responsibility without needing to be asked


**Why You’ll Want to Join Us**
* Real self-leadership — freedom to make decisions and drive your work
* Meaningful architectural influence — help shape a modular, scalable future
* Complex engineering challenges with tangible business impact
* A transparent, values-driven culture
* Collaboration over ego — engineers, designers, and product owners working as one
* Competitive salary and solid benefits


**About Us**
 With more than 50 years of experience in parking services and pioneering knowledge in car sharing, we are shaping the future of mobility. We are building comprehensive charging infrastructure for electric cars, creating efficient mobility hubs, launching new digital services, and continuously expanding our fleet of electric vehicles.
   

  

 Our goal is clear: to make life easier for our customers while promoting sustainable mobility. To achieve this, we have created an ecosystem of smart and sustainable solutions – covering everything from parking and car sharing to charging and environmentally friendly mobility hubs.
   

  

 Part of the Sumitomo Group
   

  

 Aimo is owned by Sumitomo Corporation – a global investment company and member of the Sumitomo Group. With extensive experience in long-term investments and successful business partnerships, Sumitomo is ranked in the Fortune Global 500. Their ambition is to continuously create new value and contribute positively to society – a vision we share and bring to life every day.
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm & Helsinki (Hybrid), we have 4 times a week on-site.
   

  

**Start date:** 
 As soon as possible
   

  

 Apply today and help us build the future of urban mobility at Aimo.

title: Logistics Developer
description:
**About The Role**
 We’re looking for a data-driven and curious Logistics Developer to join our Group Operations team at Instabee. In this role, you’ll help shape how parcels move between merchants, terminals, and markets — improving the efficiency and structure of our first- and middle-mile network.
   

  

 You’ll combine analytical problem-solving with hands-on operational understanding. One day you might deep dive into route data and build a model to identify bottlenecks, and the next you’ll collaborate with our local Operations Managers to test new ways of improving transport flows.
   

  

 This is a great next step for someone who’s started their career in analytics, operations, or consulting and wants to apply those skills in a fast-moving, international company — no previous logistics experience required.
   

  

**Some of the things you will do**
* Analyze transport data to identify trends, inefficiencies, and improvement opportunities
* Support local market teams in designing and optimizing first- and middle-mile routes
* Build and maintain dashboards and models to guide operational decisions
* Collaborate with Product and Tech on tools and processes that make route planning smarter
* Turn insights into actions by testing, validating, and implementing improvements


**Your future team**
 You’ll be part of Group Operations, a small but high-impact team that works across all Instabee markets (Sweden, Denmark, Finland, Norway, and the Netherlands). The team brings together people who love combining structure, data, and collaboration to solve real operational challenges.
   

  

 You’ll report to the Manager First and Middle Mile, who will support your learning and development, and work closely with a wide range of stakeholders — from Operations Managers in the field to Product Managers and Analysts at HQ.
   

  

**What We're Looking For**
 You have an analytical mindset and a genuine curiosity for how complex systems work. You like solving problems through data, but also enjoy being close to operations and seeing your ideas take shape in real life.
   

  

* 0-2 years of experience from an analytical, operations, or consulting role
* Strong analytical skills and solid proficiency in Excel or Google Sheets
* Experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau) or SQL/Snowflake is a plus
* Strong communication and collaboration skills
* A relevant degree in engineering, business, mathematics, or similar field
* Fluent in English


**More About You**
 You’re structured, proactive, and thrive in environments where not everything is defined yet. You like connecting dots across data, tools, and people — and you’re not afraid to get your hands dirty to make things happen.
   

  

 If you enjoy switching between strategic thinking and practical problem-solving, you’ll feel right at home here
   

  

 If this sounds like you, we’d love to meet you!
   

  

**What You’ll Get**
 We can promise you that you will be challenged, develop your skills and have the opportunity to work with truly amazing and competent colleagues. If you like changes and want to set new processes and ways of working - this is the place for you!
   

  

**Benefits**
 Of course, we have all the necessary and standard benefits in place, but in addition to this, we can also offer:
   

  

* 🌇 Sky-High Office: Modern and newly renovated with a 360-degree view around Stockholm.
* 🐶 Puppy Friendly: Bring your dog to work - we've got a whole floor for our furry friends!
* 🏓 Fun & Games: Ping pong, Shuffleboard, Foosball, and even a Karaoke Room for your leisure time.
* 👶 Parental Pay for Six Months: Step away from work and provide the best care and love to your little one.
* 🎂 A Day Off on Your Birthday: We love to celebrate, so enjoy your birthday to the fullest with a day off each year!m for your leisure time.
* 👶 Parental Pay for Six Months: Step away from work and provide the best care and love to your little one.
* 🎂 A Day Off on Your Birthday: We love to celebrate, so enjoy your birthday to the fullest with a day off each year!
* ⏰ Hybrid setup and flexible working hours


 Diversity and inclusion is very important to us and we are committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We want to be a workplace where everyone’s perspectives and opinions are valued, and we are dedicated to creating opportunities for all employees to thrive and reach their full potential.
   

  

**Get to know us**
 In 2022, Instabee was founded after combining Budbee and Instabox - two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox, and Porterbuddy. Instabee serves millions of consumers across Europe with convenient deliveries and is on track to become the leading European e-commerce enabler. Always with the consumer at heart.
   

  

 We’re fast, both in terms of parcel delivery and when it comes to growing our business. So far our journey has taken us from Sweden to the rest of Scandinavia and parts of continental Europe, but we have no plans on stopping anytime soon. As we continue to expand, the complexity of Instabee grows in parallel. With that in mind, we’re now looking for you to help us on the journey ahead.
   

  

*This recruitment process consists of background checks via Verifiera as a review of previous public criminal records. The result is public information that is handled confidentially. This is mandatory for all recruitment processes at Instabee in Sweden.*

title: Senior Back end Developer
description:
Vill du vara kollega med riktigt grymma och erfarna utvecklare som älskar att hålla koll på den senaste tekniken? Tycker du dessutom att sammanhållning är viktigt och att det är kul att dela med dig av dina kunskaper?
   

  

 Du kommer ha runt 25 härliga och drivna kollegor i vårt lilla bolag och ca 1000 medarbetare till om du så önskar inom B3 koncernen. På B3 CodeRight har vi en genomsnittlig arbetslivserfarenhet på över 15 år.
   

  

**Vem vi söker:**
 Du brinner för att designa och implementera robusta och skalbara backend-lösningar. Du håller dig uppdaterad på det senaste. Du är proaktiv, lyhörd och pragmatisk. Vi tycker att det är viktigt att använda rätt teknik/lösning för situationen. Om motiverat, gärna den senaste tekniken.
   

  

**Krav:**
* Tekniska färdigheter: Minst 10 års erfarenhet av backendutveckling på Microsoft stacken (C#, .NET, Azure)
* Meriterande: Microservices, Containerteknologier, CI/CD, om du vid behov även kan ta rollen som lösningsarkitekt och/eller frontendutvecklare.
* Språkkunskaper: Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska (tal och skrift)


**Vad väntar du på?** 
 Skicka din ansökan nu!
   

  

 Vill du veta mer? Tveka inte att höra av dig till VD Christian Bratt - Tel: 0702 75 48 40 /
 **christian.bratt@b3.se**
 Tyvärr kan vi ej ta emot e-postansökningar p.g.a. GDPR.
   

  

**Placering:** 
 Stockholm eller pendlingsavstånd.

title: Cloud Software Engineer
description:
Att välja Capgemini innebär att välja en arbetsplats där du ges möjlighet att forma din karriär på det sätt du själv önskar, där du ingår i en stödjande och inspirerande gemenskap med engagerade kollegor världen över, och där du får chansen att omdefiniera vad som är möjligt. Våra CloudApps-team fokuserar på att utveckla skräddarsydda cloudapplikationer, integrera IT-system och driva affärstransformation, med leverans av affärskritiska cloudlösningar i hög kvalitet och hastighet, möjliggjort av Generative AI. Bli en del av oss och hjälp världsledande organisationer att frigöra teknikens värde och bygga en mer hållbar och inkluderande framtid!
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Vill du lära dig nytt, koda och ha kul på arbetsplatsen? Då har Capgemini spännande möjligheter för dig! Bli en del av vårt Cloud AWS-team där vi kombinerar mjukvarupassion med en varm och inkluderande arbetsmiljö. Vi söker Cloud Software Engineers till vårt kontor i Stockholm. Vi arbetar som mjukvaruutvecklare som använder oss utav molntjänster och AI för att leverera nya lösningar. Hos oss får du jobba med innovativa projekt inom GenAI och Agentisk AI med Amazon Q, GitHub Copilot och AWS Bedrock. Vi erbjuder stora möjligheter till karriär och lära sig nytt – oavsett om du är i början av karriären, tech lead eller arkitekt.
   

  

*I den här rollen kommeer du att ha en nyckelroll i:*
* Utveckla mjukvarulösningar.
* Samarbeta med tvärfunktionella team med agil metodik för att producera förstklassig mjukvara.
* Implementera bästa praxis för molnarkitektur och säkerhet.
* Lära sig nya tekniker inom mjukvara, molnlösningar och AI.


**Din profil**
* 6 års erfarenhet arbetslivserfarenhet med molntjänster, inom AWS eller GCP.
* 6 års erfarenhet inom programmeringsspråk som Java, Python, Kotlin, Golang eller Node.js.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska då båda språken används i det dagliga arbetet.


**Vad vi tror kommer få dig att trivas**
* Arbeta med de senaste teknologierna och påverka på nordisk nivå. Du samarbetar med andra specialister, kompetensväxlar och bidrar till att bygga AWS-kapabilitet i Norden – samtidigt som du påverkar några av världens största bolag.
* Utvecklas genom utbildningar, certifieringar och interna initiativ- Du får tillgång till utbildningar och certifieringar inom AI och AWS samt möjlighet att engagera dig i Capgeminis fokusområden som Diversity & Inclusion, Sustainability, Wellness Club och Art Club.
* Njut av en engagerande arbetsplats med starkt stöd och förmåner. Vi erbjuder friskvårdsbidrag, tjänstepension, bonusprogram, företagshälsovård och sjukvårdsförsäkring – samt en inkluderande kontorskultur med sociala aktiviteter och teambuilding.


**Ansökan**
 Känner du igen dig i beskrivningen? Varmt välkommen in med din ansökan, vi ser fram emot att läsa den!
   

  

**Om Capgemini**
 Capgemini är en AI-driven global partner för affärs- och tekniktransformation som levererar konkret verksamhetsnytta. Vi formar framtiden för organisationer och förverkligar den med hjälp av AI, teknik och människor. Med vår starka historia på nästan 60 år är vi en ansvarsfull och mångsidig koncern med 420 000 medarbetare i över 50 länder. Genom vår expertis inom strategi, teknik, design, ingenjörstjänster och affärsverksamhet levererar vi heltäckande tjänster och lösningar, baserade på vår djupa branschkunskap och vårt omfattande partnernätverk. Koncernen rapporterade globala intäkter på 22,1 miljarder euro för 2024.
   

  

**Make it real** 
 | www.capgemini.com
   

  

*Som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess kommer identitetskontroll att genomföras genom granskning av ID-kort, och bakgrundkontroller kan utföras vid behov.*
*Till denna roll söker vi medarbetare för säkerhetsklassat uppdrag placerad hos kund.*

title: Senior Integration Lead Developer
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Vill du vara med i Sveriges vassaste integrations-team? Då är du rätt person för oss! Nu söker vi Dig som vill jobba som Integration Lead Developer på CGI.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder dig som har ett brinnande intresse för integrationsutveckling på Microsoft-plattformen att börja i ett team som arbetar tätt tillsammans. Normalt sitter vi ihop och arbetar från vårt kontor i Stadshagen. Vi arbetar med spännande kunder i alla branscher vilket gör att du ständigt får nya utmaningar och möjlighet att vidareutvecklas.
   

  

 På CGI strävar vi efter att skapa framgångsrika team som har roligt på jobbet och hjälper varandra att utvecklas. CGI är Sveriges ledande IT-företag och ett av världens största. Detta ger fantastiska karriärmöjligheter och möjlighet till spännande uppdrag. Vårt framgångsrika integrationsteam är som ett eget litet företag inom ramarna för stora CGI vilket ger en stark teamkänsla och samhörighet.
   

  

 CGI är Microsoft Gold Partner inom Application Integration. Vårt integrationsteam i Stockholm går för högvarv och behöver förstärkning. Här får Du möjlighet att jobba med några av de bästa integrationsutvecklarna i branschen!
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

* Utveckla robusta, säkra och återanvändbara integrationslösningar med hjälp av Azure Integration Services: Logic Apps, Azure Service Bus, API Management, Event Grid och Azure Functions
* Leda tekniska designdiskussioner, definiera integrationsmönster och bidra till lösningsarkitekturen
* Fungera som teknisk ledare för integrationsprojekt och säkerställa överensstämmelse med affärs- och IT-strategier
* Samarbeta nära med lösningsarkitekter, företagsarkitekter och affärsintressenter
* Mentorera och stödja junior-/mellannivåutvecklare och främja bästa praxis och kodkvalitet
* Driva implementeringen av DevOps och automatiseringsmetoder för integrationspipelines (CI/CD, Infrastructure as Code)
* Övervaka integrationsprestanda och proaktivt identifiera förbättringar
* Äga hela livscykeln för integrationer – från kravinsamling till produktionssupport


 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* 5 till 8+ års erfarenhet i integrationsutveckling, med stark erfarenhet av att designa och implementera lösningar på Azure iPaas
* Djupgående kunskaper om Azure Logic Apps, Service Bus, API Management, Azure Functions, Event Grid och hybridanslutningsalternativ
* Bevisad meritlista inom design av API-baserade arkitekturer, eventdrivna flöden och molnbaserade integrationer
* Stark kunskap om autentiseringsmekanismer (OAuth 2.0, OpenID Connect, Azure AD) och bästa praxis för säkerhet i integrationer
* Kunskaper inom CI/CD-pipelines (helst med Azure DevOps)
* Erfarenhet av övervaknings- och observationsverktyg (t.ex. App Insights, Log Analytics)
* Stark förståelse för integrationsmönster, mikrotjänster och tjänsteorienterad arkitektur (SOA)
* Utmärkta kommunikations-, ledarskaps- och intressenthanteringsfärdigheter
* Kunskap om docker och containers
* Obehindrad svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


 Meriterande om du också har:
   

  

* Microsoft-certifieringar (t.ex. Azure Solutions Architect, Azure Developer Associate)
* Erfarenhet av att integrera med SAP, Dynamics 365, Salesforce eller andra on-premise system
* Kännedom om BizTalk-migreringar till Azure eller strategier för modernisering av integrationer
* Exponering för dataströmningsplattformar (t.ex. Kafka, Event Hubs)
* Bakgrund inom agila/Scrum-metoder


**Vad du kan förvänta dig av oss:**
 Integrationsteamet på CGI är ett gäng som trivs ihop, delar kunskap och stöttar varandra. Här är det lätt att vara sig själv, och det finns alltid någon att bolla idéer med. Ibland gör vi något kul tillsammans efter jobbet, som en spelkväll – bara om man vill, såklart!
   

  

**Låter det intressant?**
 Vi ser fram emot att höra ifrån dig! Skicka in din ansökan redan i dag då urvalet sker löpande. Har du frågor om rollen, kontakta gärna rekryterande konsultchef Ramya Parthasarathy, ramya.parthasarathy@cgi.com eller konsultchef Henrik Sjöstedt, henrik,sjostedt@cgi.com.
   

  

**Vad CGI erbjuder dig**
 CGIs kombination av global och lokal närvaro, med kontor på 30 orter i Sverige, ger nöjda kunder men innebär även att du som anställd alltid har ett kontor nära dig. Detta i kombination med flexibla arbetstider ger dig möjlighet till balans mellan privatliv och arbete, oavsett var i livet just du befinner dig.
   

  

 På CGI finns även stora möjligheter till interna karriärvägar där du kan välja att bli specialist inom ditt område, bredda dig inom nya områden eller ta en ledande befattning. Via våra interna nätverk, projekt och åtaganden i globala och nationella industrier, erbjuder vi dig kompetensutveckling och engagerade ledare som stöttar just dig i din utveckling.
   

  

 Mer information om våra förmåner:
   

  

* Aktieprogram och delägarskap: Som delägare har du möjlighet att påverka och i vårt aktieprogram matchar CGI ditt bidrag, krona för krona upp till 3% av din månadslön.
* Friskvårdsbidrag: Vi erbjuder ett årligt friskvårdsbidrag på 4000 kr.
* Föräldralön: Vi betalar upp till cirka 90% av din lön under den första tiden hemma.
* Trygg anställning: Våra konsulter anställs med kollektivavtal och försäkringar.
* Pensionslösningar: Vi erbjuder attraktiva och förmånliga pensionslösningar.
* Personalbil: Personalbilen används som en privatbil men leasas av CGI.


**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Senior Engineering Manager for CRM & Marketing Technology
description:
**Craft:**
 Technology & Development
   

  

**Job Description:**
 The Senior Engineering Manager for Marketing & Promotions leads and manages a critical team within King’s Player Experience Operations organization. This role is accountable for building, scaling, and maintaining systems that underpin King’s product marketing capabilities. These systems are foundational to King’s player-centric strategy and enable cross-game personalization, marketing and engagement. The team’s mission is to equip game teams with the tools, data, and capabilities needed to deliver impactful player experiences and interactions. The engineering manager will need to bridge content, data, and operations to enable effective marketing across channels inside and outside the games. This may extend to overseeing a virtual team including team members from other Live Ops sub-domains and Game Platform’s Core Data team.
   

  

* Goals


**Goal 1: Deliver Scalable, Secure and Compliant Consumer Marketing Systems**
 What: Evolve and maintain high-reliability marketing and engagement systems (e.g. Braze, segmentation and events management) that enable player engagement while respecting privacy and player data.
   

  

 Why: Marketing is foundational to driving player engagement: from onboarding new players, reactivating players and nudging active players towards monetization. At King we rely on a combination of third party tools including Braze to work seamlessly with our internal data and Live Ops capabilities. Robust marketing technology reduces friction, supports tentpole events such as All Stars alternative payments and ensures long-term growth in player lifetime value. This role contributes to a virtual team that aims to deliver exceptional, enjoyable and personal experiences to our player base, enabled through technology and an internal operating model that prioritise scalability, collaboration and speed-to-market.
   

  

**Key Activities:**
* Modernize marketing technology and supporting systems to support marketeers’ needs for automated, scalable consumer messaging with high reliability and security.
* Collaborate with Product and Marketing stakeholders to meet evolving business requirements.
* Drive standardization and platform-wide adoption of core marketing technology and tools.


**Potential Success Metrics:**
* 30% reduction in setup time for marketing campaigns across games.
* Player engagement uplift tied to new marketing technology capabilities and data connectivity.
* Internal NPS from game teams on marketeer experience.
* Increased productivity per FTE and Elevate daily work (# of campaigns able to be supported)
* Improved time-to-market for innovation (# of new features built, Reduced time-to-value) and overall Rate of Improvement


**Goal 2: Deliver data connections between King and Third-Party systems to improve overall reporting and attribution for all CRM activity and improve automation capabilities
 *(managing dependencies on contributing teams)***
 What: Ensure we build and maintain APIs and services enabling data connectivity in alignment with Candy CRM and Shared Tech Live Ops needs.
   

  

 Why: Availability of data via our Marketing Tech Platform including third-party tools is essential for triggering marketing comms to players and for reporting on campaign effectiveness. A scalable and reusable approach is required and will reduce duplication across games.
   

  

**Key Activities:**
* Design and oversee a unified data-exchange contract between Unified Platform (UP) services and Braze, defining events, attributes, and consent flags.
* Build real-time and batch pipelines that make gameplay, economy, and segmentation data available to marketeers within defined SLAs.
* Expose self-serve APIs & SDKs so game teams can push new data attributes or subscribe to downstream campaign results without bespoke work.
* Orchestrate cross-domain architecture reviews with Game Platform Core Data and Live Ops to ensure reuse of identity, consent, and compliance components (GDPR/CCPA).
* Automate data-quality monitoring & alerting (e.g., schema drift, null rates, PII violations) and ensure proactive monitoring for stakeholders.
* Pilot advanced attribution & suppression logic (multi-touch, channel fatigue) and document playbooks for marketers.


**Potential Success Metrics:**
- Increased scale of activity (ratio of personalised vs bulk comms.)

 < 5 % schema-drift incidents/quarter detected by automated monitoring.
 - 50 % reduction in manual data-mapping effort for new campaigns (measured via onboarding surveys).

- Marketeer NPS +20 points for “data availability & reliability” dimension versus prior baseline.

- Responsibilities

**Define & Communicate the Engineering Strategy for Marketing & Promotions**
 Develop a cohesive vision and execution plan across the two teams to deliver scalable, compliant, and game-integrated systems. Align this strategy with Shared Tech’s mission of player-centricity, and King’s business goals of enabling trusted and engaging player experiences.
   

  

**Drive Cross-Domain Collaboration and Integration**
 Ensure that Marketing and Promotions systems are interoperable with Game Systems, Live Ops, Economy, and Player Data. Partner across functions to break silos and accelerate safe, secure game delivery.
   

  

**Champion Operational Excellence And Developer Experience**
 Embed high standards of automation, observability, and reliability. Reduce manual overhead for game teams by standardizing integrations and platform contracts. Actively improve onboarding and usage of Social and Identity APIs.
   

  

**Enable Scalable Infrastructure**
 Lead engineering delivery of systems that abstract regulatory complexity away from game teams. Partner with CRM and PXO stakeholders to turn requirements into resilient technical capabilities.
   

  

**Foster a High-Performance, Supportive Engineering Culture**
 Recruit, grow, and retain top engineering talent. Promote psychological safety, autonomy, and continuous feedback. Create an inclusive culture where experimentation, knowledge sharing, and accountability thrive.
   

  

* Essential Knowledge


**Marketing Technology and Live Games as a Service**
 Deep understanding of consumer marketing technologies (Braze, Swrve or competitors), secure data management, and Live Ops strategies across devices and platforms.
   

  

**MarTech Engineering**
 Proven ability to build backend services at scale to engage global audiences. Familiarity with MarTech trends and global data privacy regulations.
   

  

**Backend Scalability & Operability**
 Demonstrated experience building high-volume, high-availability services with strong observability, alerting, and recovery practices.
   

  

* Key Skills
* Technical Strategy & System Architecture: Ability to architect and guide complex distributed systems across identity, compliance, and social domains.
* Cross-Functional Alignment: Skilled at aligning Legal, Product, Engineering, and Game teams behind a unified technical direction.
* Execution Excellence & Flow Efficiency: Strong delivery leadership with focus on rapid iteration, automation, and shortening cycle times without sacrificing quality.
* Organizational Leadership & Coaching: A leader of leaders, able to grow engineering managers and build a resilient, high-trust engineering culture.
* Change Management & Communication: Comfortable navigating ambiguity, aligning diverse stakeholders, and communicating complex concepts clearly at all levels.


**About King**
 With a mission of
 *Making the World Playful* 
 , King is a leading interactive entertainment company with more than 20 years of history of delivering some of the world’s most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry, including the world-famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as other mobile game hits such as
 *Farm Heroes Sag* 
 a. King games are played by more than 200 million monthly active users. King, part of Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT), has Kingsters in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona, Berlin, Dublin, San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles and Malta. More information can be found at King.com or by following us on LinkedIn, @lifeatking on Instagram, or @king\_games on X.

title: Technical Product Manager – Development Excellence (Bangkok-based, relocation provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 At Agoda, we bridge the world through travel. Our story began in 2005, when two lifelong friends and entrepreneurs, driven by their passion for travel, launched Agoda to make it easier for everyone to explore the world.
   

  

 Today, we are part of Booking Holdings [NASDAQ: BKNG], with a diverse team of over 7,000 people from 90 countries, working together in offices around the globe. Every day, we connect people to destinations and experiences, with our great deals across our millions of hotels and holiday properties, flights, and experiences worldwide.
   

  

 No two days are the same at Agoda. Data and technology are at the heart of our culture, fueling our curiosity and innovation. If you’re ready to begin your best journey and help build travel for the world, join us.
   

  

**Get to Know our Team**
 At Agoda, the Technical Product Management (TPM) team drives the development of essential platforms and tools that empower our engineering organization to scale efficiently while delivering top-quality products at speed. We are seeking top-tier talent to join us in this critical mission. The TPM team plays a pivotal role, partnering with business users, product managers, engineers, and other stakeholders who rely on high-performing, best-in-class applications to excel in their roles. From our advanced data platform and private cloud infrastructure to developer experience frameworks, we strive to optimize processes and create solutions our employees love, ensuring seamless operations across Agoda.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 At Agoda, the Technical Product Management (TPM) team drives the development of essential platforms and tools that empower our engineering organization to scale efficiently while delivering top-quality products at speed. We are seeking top-tier talent to join us in this critical mission. The TPM team plays a pivotal role, partnering with business users, product managers, engineers, and other stakeholders who rely on high-performing, best-in-class applications to excel in their roles. From our advanced data platform and private cloud infrastructure to developer experience frameworks, we strive to optimize processes and create solutions our employees love, ensuring seamless operations across Agoda.
   

  

**In This Role, You’ll Get to**
* Own the product from concept to design, specification, implementation, and analysis.
* Gather and synthesize requirements and input from multiple stakeholders (internal product teams, engineers, business teams, etc.).
* Lead in-person conversations with internal customers to understand users, priorities, and feature considerations.
* Demonstrate strong leadership, organizational and execution skills, to drive product development projects from concept to launch, and operate in a fast- paced setting.
* Excellent leadership and communication skills. Expected to be asking questions, listening, driving team alignment, and influencing without authority across all levels of the organization.
* Bridge business and technical worlds very well, a good conceptual problem solver to articulate opportunities and solutions.
* Technical confidence. You’ll need to work with senior/lead engineers to balance product velocity and technical debt tradeoffs.


**What You’ll Need To Succeed**
* 3+ years technical product management experience in a fast-paced innovative environment, or significant technical management experience.
* 5+ years (in total) of technical experience in one or more areas: Software Engineering / Developer Experience – Software development innovation, engineering tooling products, developer lifecycle management across large organizations.
* Excellent interpersonal skills, energetic, and a self-starter
* Excellent presentation skills
* Strong organizational skills along with demonstrated ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously and able to react to shifting priorities to meet business needs.
* Effective communicator (written and verbal). Able to communicate effectively with both business and technical teams.
* Demonstrated analytical and quantitative skills. You use data to make decisions and are comfortable gathering it yourself or working with others to gather it. (analytics, statistics, SQL, BI tools)
* A problem-solving mindset.
* The ability and positive mindset to “figure things out.”
* This position requires a successful candidate to relocate fully to Bangkok, Thailand, where relocation support is provided.

**Discover More About Working At Agoda**
* Agoda Careers https://careersatagoda.com
* Facebook https://www.facebook.com/agodacareers/
